name: Iconic Menubar - Crystal SVG
description:
Check out the original style at userstyles.org
Adds icons to the menubars. If you want the menubar to be all icons with no text, install style 1119 in addition to this style. Uses icons from CuteMenus - Crystal SVG (mostly Crystal SVG icons). Supports Firefox, Flock, Thunderbird, and (somewhat) Sunbird. Sunbird support should work fine if you replace the images with local (or chrome) files. Supported extensions: Adblock Plus, Calculator, Chipmark, Compact Menu, del.icio.us, DOM Inspector, EditTXT, FastEdit, Firefox Google Bookmarks, HyperBK, More Tools Menu, MR Tech Local Install, PlainOldFavorites, SamePlace, Split Browser, Tabs Menu, Testo - Text Editer, and Tiny Menu. Remove the specific related -moz-document line at the beginning to de-iconify any specific window. Simply replace the url next to the correct list-style-image (I've marked each one) with your own image if you want to replace any. No additional changes required. Also, you can remove any specific item if you don't want an icon for it at all.
additional_info:
>2006-11-20:
-Modified so that there will no longer be any effects whatsoever on unsupported menus (menus with no assigned icon).
-Cleaned up some unnecessary code that was used to fix some problems with some slightly older versions of CuteMenus - Crystal SVG.
-Attempted to add Sunbird support, but Sunbird apparently doesn't like data:uri. I left the proper code in, however, so that it will work when/if Sunbird ever fixes that, or for anyone who wants to change the icons to use local file paths.
-Also attempted to add support for SeaMonkey, Netscape, and Songbird, but they annoyed me so much I wanted to kick my computer, so I dropped that for now.
@Indoobidubly: I changed Tools away from that wrench icon approx. 1 month ago (almost to the day), but, if you want to change it back, either A) cut "menubar > menu#tools-menu," from the block it's in and paste it directly above the /* More Tools */ line, or B) Copy the data:image from the More Tools block and paste it in place of the data:image under the main Tools block.
>2006-11-26:
-Fixed spacing between icons and text so it's the same as with the normal menu items in the Firefox default theme (rather than having no space at all).
>2006-11-27:
-No changes, just updated screenshot.
>2006-11-28:
-Various padding tweaks, mainly to work with some changes to the FlatStyle option for CuteMenus - Crystal SVG (even though this is now included as an option in CuteMenus as well, though some different icons are used here), to allow themes' own padding to shine through in more ways, and for more Minefield compatibility.
>2006-12-03:
-Fixed icon padding not working right in some somewhat common situations.
-Changed Edit icon because the old one did not appear centered (had a faint shadow on the right side) and thus gave the illusion of incorrect padding.
>2006-12-16:
-Removed partial support for theme padding/margins/alignment so it will actually work in non-default themes without the themes having to add any special code to allow for the possibility of icons appearing on the menubar. The current padding/margins are based on the default theme in Minefield, but may look a little different with any other theme or version (not bad or anything, just a bit different from "normal").
-Removed requirement for Firefox 2.0 [and equivalents] and lower to restart after applying this style.
>2007-01-04:
-Added support for Tiny Menu, Tabs Menu, and Calculator.
>2007-05-06:
-Added support for SamePlace and Split Browser.
>2007-06-04:
-No changes to the style, just moved the line in the description telling how to do Icons-Only to a more obvious location, for those people [...] who can't be bothered to read the entire description.
>2008-01-05:
-Updated to work in Firefox 3 betas.
